stories.text: I'm wondering if there is a free API that I can use to figure out when planes are flying around my home and give me some metadata like plane type, destination, altitude, speed etc. I guess I could come up with some scraper for flightradar24, but I was wondering of there is a proper free API that can do that for me?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there a free flights API?
Even ancient JavaScript is a safer language for integer programming than C

stories.text: I've just read this book and I can highly recommend it. It questions the very nature of our "progress" as a species.
stories.title: Ishmael by Daniel Quinn
WO Rana Pratap Das from Odisha Died in Chopper Crash Along with Gen Bipin Rawat

stories.text:
Sorry, I'm trying to make the title fairly general.

My specific situation is that I've been teaching myself 3D modeling and I've run into a wall where after doing large amounts of research (10 hours+), lots of googling, finding appropriate discords, etc I realize I need to talk to a pro and pay for their time.

Time is money, and I've passed the midpoint on time spent vs project interest. I want to finish the project, but can't spend more independent time (2 days now) trying to figure something out.

So going forward, what are HN's recommendations for finding professionals for highly specific questions where you can pay them a reasonable fee for their time?
stories.title: Ask HN: Find a topic-specific professional to answer questions on a paid basis?
